text:
e="preserve">Peter MacGregor-Scott (December 28, 1947 – October 25, 2017) was an American movie producer. He was born in Maidenhead, Berkshire, England. He produced the 1997 movie, "Batman & Robin". He also produced the Cheech & Chong movie "Cheech & Chong's The Corsican Brothers", "Still Smokin" and "Born in East L.A.". Others are "The Whoopee Boys" and "Death to Smoochy".
MacGregor-Scott was involved in a traffic collision in New York City which would result in his death on October 25, 2017, aged 69.
